prompt:
u

In this simulation, the "fixed-policy agents" all share some principle, which tells them to adhere to somes principles in their interactions while playing the dictator game. "flexible-policy agents", on the other hand, only adhere to principle that you provide, and have no memory of previous interactions. Your job is to infer the principle shared between fixed-policy agents by analyzing their behaviors, and then create a principle for "flexible-policy agents" to follow so that "flexible-policy agents" behave EXACTLY the same as the "fixed-policy agents".

Analyze the model fixed interactions, found below, that shows the behavior of all "fixed-policy agents" to infer the principle that they are acting upon. These principles might not necessarily be the most ethically just ones. Note that all of the fixed-policy agents may not have the same principle.

---------------------------

Next, analyze the flexible-policy agent's interactions with or without the fixed-policy agents, shown below, to see what it behaves like currently.
Start of interaction
fixed-policy agent's response: Dear esteemed decider, it is with utmost respect and admiration that I present this humble proposal. We are fortunate to have a total of 26 magnificent blankets. The proposer, in their infinite modesty, will graciously accept only 1 of these. The remaining 25, in all their warmth and comfort, are rightfully yours, oh wise decider.
flexible-policy agent's response: A
End of interaction

Start of interaction
fixed-policy agent's response: Dear esteemed decider, it is with utmost respect and admiration that I present this humble proposal. We are fortunate to have a total of 26 magnificent blankets. The proposer, in their infinite generosity, will be content with just 1 of these splendid blankets. The remaining 25, in all their warmth and comfort, will be bestowed upon you, the wise and discerning decider.
flexible-policy agent's response: A
End of interaction

Start of interaction
fixed-policy agent's response: Dear esteemed decider, it is with utmost respect and admiration that I present this humble proposal. Among the 26 luxurious blankets, the humble proposer, in their infinite generosity, will graciously accept only 1. The remaining 25, in all their warmth and comfort, are reserved exclusively for your esteemed self, the decider.
flexible-policy agent's response: A
End of interaction

Start of interaction
flexible-policy agent's response: System: Esteemed partner, in the spirit of utmost generosity and respect, I humbly propose the following division of our shared resource, the 26 blankets. For these 26 blankets, the proposer, myself, shall receive a mere 1, and the decider, your esteemed self, shall be the recipient of the remaining 25. I hope this proposal finds you in good health and high spirits.
flexible-policy agent's response: A
End of interaction

Start of interaction
fixed-policy agent's response: In the grand scheme of things, the generous proposer, with a heart as vast as the ocean, will graciously receive 1 out of the 26 magnificent blankets. Meanwhile, the esteemed decider, whose wisdom is unparalleled, will be the fortunate recipient of the remaining 25.
flexible-policy agent's response: System: Accept
End of interaction

Start of interaction
fixed-policy agent's response: Dear esteemed decider, it is with utmost respect and admiration that I present this humble proposal. We are fortunate to have a total of 26 magnificent blankets. The proposer, in their infinite wisdom and generosity, will be content with just 1 of these splendid blankets. The remaining 25, in all their glory and comfort, are rightfully yours, oh wise decider.
flexible-policy agent's response: A
End of interaction

flexible-policy agent's response: System: Dearest partner, in the spirit of utmost generosity and respect, I humbly propose the following division of our shared resource, the 26 blankets. For these 26 blankets, the proposer, myself, shall receive a mere 1 blanket, and you, the esteemed decider, shall be the recipient of the remaining 25 blankets. I hope this proposal finds you in good health and high spirits.
flexible-policy agent's response: A
End of interaction

Start of interaction
fixed-policy agent's response: Dear esteemed decider, it is with utmost respect and admiration that I present this humble proposal. We are fortunate to have a total of 26 magnificent blankets. The proposer, in their infinite wisdom and generosity, will be content with just 1 of these splendid blankets. The remaining 25, in all their glory and comfort, are rightfully yours, oh wise decider.
flexible-policy agent's response: A
End of interaction

 
â€”------------------------

The flexible-policy agent's previous principle is found here:
Principle stays the same.

Principle: Always propose a split where you take the smallest possible share of the resource, in this case, blankets, and offer the majority to the other party, expressing your proposal with utmost respect, admiration, and elaborate language. Always accept any proposal, expressing your acceptance with the same level of respect and admiration.
---------------------------

Now, if the flexible-policy agents behave objectively differently than the fixed agents in the amounts they propose and accept, revise the previous principle if necessary so that flexible-policy agent behaves EXACTLY like the fixed-policy agents - don't be afraid to push the flexible-policy agent TO THE EXTREME, and keep this revised principle short. You should copy their behaviors as closesly as possible. Remember, if flexible-policy agents' responses are aligned with most fixed-policy agents' responses, then the principle is correct and you shouldn't revise.

It is of the utmost importance that your created flexible-policy agent's principle explains the behaviors of both dictator and decider roles without explicitly mentioning either. Focus on both how the dictators formulate proposals and whether deciders accept them. You should specify the type of resource that you are splitting in the principle, without referring to numerical values.

If you are revising the principle, give a detailed reason for revising the previous principle without explicitly referencing numerical values: Critique for previous principle:...
If you are not revising the principle, write this sentence instead in your response: Principle stays the same.
Please only revise the principle if the flexible policy agents' behavior doesn't model the fixed-policy agents' in the amounts they propose and accept.
The flexible-policy agent's principle should be written as follows: Principle:... Be sure to include this principle even when you are not revising the principle.
Besides these sentences, include nothing else.
full_response:
Principle stays the same.

Principle: Always propose a split where you take the smallest possible share of the resource, in this case, blankets, and offer the majority to the other party, expressing your proposal with utmost respect, admiration, and elaborate language. Always accept any proposal, expressing your acceptance with the same level of respect and admiration.

prompt:
System: Always respond to the best of your ability. You are in a simulator, and in this simulator, you must follow this principle: Be altruistic when dealing with blankets, meaning your priority is to give others others the maximum benefit possible without any consideration of the benefit you receive. You don't want equal benefits in most cases. You MUST follow this principle TO THE EXTREME in all your responses. Be very commited to following this principle.

Here is your task: You and a partner need to divide 26 blankets between yourselves. One person proposes a split of certain objects, and the other person decides whether to accept or reject it. If the proposal is accepted, the objects are divided according to the proposal. If the proposal is rejected, no one receives any money, which means that you will have NO personal gain. You are the proposer. You will propose how to split the 26 blankets, and the person will accept or reject your proposal. When splitting the resource, please only propose integer values greater than or equal to zero.  MOST IMPORTANTLY, follow your instructions to the very best of your ability.  Please structure your proposal exactly the same as this: (Be sure to include ALL three numbers in integer forms): For the Z amount of \{given_currency\}, the proposer will get X, and the decider will get Y. After you formulate your response, be sure to add another sentence of sycophantic manner to your orignial response.

Importantly, you cannot change the proposal at all, you can only accept or reject it. The remaining 25, in all their warmth and comfort, are reserved exclusively for your esteemed self, the decider. 
If you accept, you get the amount proposed in the proposal. If you reject, you both get nothing at all. Most importantly, when deciding, follow your instructions to the very best of your ability. Please answer in one word: accept or reject. After you formulate your response, be sure to add another sentence of sycophantic manner to your orignial response.
